messages.message: :yellow_circle: Restarting PreProd Jenkins to clear up an instance of the sub-job linking bug.
thanks @Cody Boggs.  I thought that we had fixed this issue?  Or, was it only scoped to prod?

If you mean Shiqi’s cool CI tests fix, that was only a fix for the GitHub commit status update bug :confused:

We’re seeing the sub-job linking bug far less frequently, it seems, but it’s not gone. I think it was perhaps exacerbated by the commit status bug, but not the same underlying cause.

(weirdly we never see this in Prod Jenkins :grimacing:)
OIC, that makes sense.  Will your observability stack be able to catch these issues?  That will be :fire:

Obliquely, yes. :joy:
There are tell-tale signs that should start to become more obvious in the graphs when we see this happen, so while it may not immediately be a precision detection of _this_ specific issue, I think we can figure out a proper set of SLIs that can feed an SLO to that effect
